Presenting Problem / Chief Complaint: The patient has applied for a job they previously discussed, expressing feelings of pride despite experiencing anxiety during the application process.
History of Present Illness (HPI): The patient reports feeling anxious about the job application but has moments of hope and doubt. They are trying to manage their feelings of uncertainty and self-criticism.
Physiological Observations: The patient feels more relaxed and less anxious after going for walks in the park.
Current Functional Status: The patient is engaging in positive activities such as applying for jobs and taking care of themselves through walks and affirmations.
Progress Evaluation: The patient feels they have made progress and acknowledges their efforts in managing anxiety and self-care.
Therapeutic Interventions: The patient is using affirmations and self-compassion techniques to counter negative thoughts.
Next Steps: The patient plans to incorporate more time at a peaceful spot in the park into their routine and continue focusing on positives.
